$ul: **additional_config_cmds**: additional CLI commands to append to the generated switches config
**enabled**: enable Advanced Analytic feature (using SUB-ANA license) (default: false)
**model_specific**: the property key is the AP model (e.g "AP32")
**auto_placement**: if we're able to determine its x/y/orientation, this will be populated
**auto_preemption**: schedule to preempt ap’s which are not connected to preferred peer
**enabled**: whether auto preemption should happen (default: false)
**custom_versions**: custom versions for different models. The property key is the model name (e.g. "AP41")
**enabled**: whether auto upgrade should happen (Note that Mist may auto-upgrade if the version is not supported) (default: false)
**time_of_day**: any / HH:MM (24-hour format), upgrade will happen within up to 1-hour from this time
**beacon_enabled**: whether Mist beacons is enabled (default: true)

**beam_disabled**: list of AP BLE location beam numbers (1-8) which should be disabled at the AP and not transmit location information (where beam 1 is oriented at the top the AP, growing counter-clock-wise, with 9 being the omni BLE beam)
**eddystone_uid_adv_power**: advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default
**eddystone_uid_enabled**: only if `beacon_enabled`==`false`, Whether Eddystone-UID beacon is enabled
**eddystone_uid_freq_msec**: Frequency (msec) of data emmit by Eddystone-UID beacon
**eddystone_url_adv_power**: advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default
**eddystone_url_enabled**: only if `beacon_enabled`==`false`, Whether Eddystone-URL beacon is enabled
**eddystone_url_freq_msec**: Frequency (msec) of data emmit by Eddystone-UID beacon
**ibeacon_adv_power**: advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default
**ibeacon_enabled**: can be enabled if `beacon_enabled`==`true`, whether to send iBeacon (default: false)
**ibeacon_freq_msec**: Frequency (msec) of data emmit for iBeacon
**ibeacon_uuid**: optional, if not specified, the same UUID as the beacon will be used
**config_auto_revert**: whether to enable ap auto config revert (default: false)
**device_updown_threshold**: sending AP_DISCONNECTED event in device-updowns only if AP_CONNECTED is not seen within the threshold, in minutes (default: 0)
**enable_channel_144**: whether to enable channel 144 (some older clients may not support it) (default: false)
**engagement**: **Note**: if hours does not exist, it’s treated as everyday of the week, 00:00-23:59. Currently we don’t allow multiple ranges for the same day
**dwell_tags**: add tags to visits within the duration (in seconds), available tags (passerby, bounce, engaged, stationed)
**hours**: hours of operation filter, the available days (mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat, sun).
**max_dwell**: max time, default is 43200(12h), max is 68400 (18h) (default: 43200)
**core_as_border**: optional, for ERB or CLOS, you can either use esilag to upstream routers or to also be the virtual-gateway (default: false)
**per_vlan_vga_v4_mac**: by default, JUNOS uses 00-00-5e-00-01-01 as the virtual-gateway-address's v4-mac (default: false)
**routed_at**: optional, where virtual-gateway should reside (default: edge)
**flags**: name/val pair objects for location engine to use
**gateway_additional_config_cmds**: additional CLI commands to append to the generated config for gateways
**admin_sshkeys**: for SSR only, as direct root access is not allowed
**app_usage**: consumes uplink bandwidth, requires WA license
**time_of_day**: optional, Mist will decide the timing
**config_revert_timer**: he rollback timer for commit confirmed (default: 10)
**mxedge**: site mist edges form a cluster of radsecproxy servers
**mist_das**: configure cloud-assisted dynamic authorization service on this cluster of mist edges
**coa_servers**: dynamic authorization clients configured to send CoA|DM to mist edges on port 3799
**acct_servers**: list of RADIUS accounting servers, optional, order matters where the first one is treated as primary
**auth_servers**: list of RADIUS authentication servers, order matters where the first one is treated as primary
**enabled**: whether to enable service on Mist Edge i.e. RADIUS proxy over TLS
**match_ssid**: whether to match ssid in request message to select from a subset of RADIUS servers
**proxy_hosts**: hostnames or IPs for Mist AP to use as the TLS Server (i.e. they are reachable from AP) in addition to `tunterm_hosts`
**server_selection**: ordered (default) / unordered. When ordered, Mist Edge will prefer and go back to the first radius server if possible (default: ordered)
**source**: Specify source address to use when connecting to RADIUS servers (default: any)
**ap_subnets**: list of subnets where we allow AP to establish Mist Tunnels from
**clusters**: for AP, how to connect to tunterm or radsecproxy
**hello_interval**: in seconds, used as heartbeat to detect if a tunnel is alive. AP will try another peer after missing N hellos specified by hello_retries (default: 60)
**hosts**: hostnames or IPs where a Mist Tunnel will use as the Peer (i.e. they are reachable from AP)
**mtu**: 0 to enable PMTU, 552-1500 to start PMTU with a lower MTU (default: 0)
**vlan_ids**: list of vlan_ids that will be use
**networks**: the property key is the network name
**assets_enabled**: indicate whether named BLE assets should be included in the zone occupancy calculation (default: false)
**clients_enabled**: indicate whether connected WiFi clients should be included in the zone occupancy calculation (default: true)
**sdkclients_enabled**: indicate whether SDK clients should be included in the zone occupancy calculation (default: false)
**unconnected_clients_enabled**: indicate whether unconnected WiFi clients should be included in the zone occupancy calculation (default: false)
**ospf_areas**: the property key is the OSPF area
**persist_config_on_device**: whether to store the config on AP (default: false)
**port_mirroring**: Property key is the port mirroring instance name
**port_usages**: the property key is the port usage name

**dynamic**: This is a special mode where the actually usage is determined by a set of rules the port will start with `access` mode and isolated depending on the rules, if resolved, the port will have the resolved usage applied.
**reset_default_when**: Control when the DPC port should be changed to the default port usage (default: link_down)
**proxy**: Proxy Configuration for APs and Site Edges to talk to Mist
**ant_gain_24**: antenna gain for 2.4G - for models with external antenna only
**ant_gain_5**: antenna gain for 5G - for models with external antenna only
**ant_gain_6**: antenna gain for 6G - for models with external antenna only
**bandwidth**: channel width for the band, 20 / 40 / 80 / 160, 80 is only applicable for band_5 and 160 is only for band_6, ignored if channel is 0
**channel**: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting
**channels**: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto
**power**: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 mean using the Site Setting
**power_max**: when power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**power_min**: when power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**band_24_usage**: if `band_24_usage`==`5`, by default, band_5 properties is used, if specific channel/bandwidth/power/... is desired, use the "band_5_on_24_radio" (default: 24)
**bandwidth**: channel width for the band, 20 / 40 / 80 / 160, 80 is only applicable for band_5 and 160 is only for band_6, ignored if channel is 0
**channel**: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting
**channels**: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto
**power**: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 mean using the Site Setting
**power_max**: when power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**power_min**: when power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**bandwidth**: channel width for the band, 20 / 40 / 80 / 160, 80 is only applicable for band_5 and 160 is only for band_6, ignored if channel is 0
**channel**: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting
**channels**: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto
**power**: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 mean using the Site Setting
**power_max**: when power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**power_min**: when power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**bandwidth**: channel width for the band, 20 / 40 / 80 / 160, 80 is only applicable for band_5 and 160 is only for band_6, ignored if channel is 0
**channel**: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting
**channels**: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto
**power**: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 mean using the Site Setting
**power_max**: when power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set
**power_min**: when power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

**acct_interim_interval**: how frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from RADIUS Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled (default: 0)
**network**: if source_address is configured, will use the vlan firstly otherwise use source_ip
**report_gatt**: whether AP should periodically connect to BLE devices and report GATT device info (device name, manufacturer name, serial number, battery %, temperature, humidity) (default: false)
**enabled**: whether or not rogue detection is enabled
**honeypot_enabled**: whether or not honeypot detection is enabled
**min_duration**: minimum duration for a bssid to be considered rogue (default: 10)
**min_rssi**: minimum RSSI for an AP to be considered rogue (ignoring APs that’s far away) (default: -80)
**whitelisted_bssids**: list of BSSIDs to whitelist. Ex: "cc-:8e-:6f-:d4-:bf-:16", "cc-8e-6f-d4-bf-16", "cc-73-*", "cc:82:*"
**simple_alert**: Set of heuristic rules will be enabled when marvis subscription is not available.
**ssh_keys**: when limit_ssh_access = true in Org Setting, list of SSH public keys provided by Mist Support to install onto APs (see Org:Setting)
**additional_config_cmds**: additional CLI commands to append if this rule matches

**ap_affinity_threshold**: ap_affinity_threshold ap_affinity_threshold can be added as a field under site/setting. By default this value is set to 12. If the field is set in both site/setting and org/setting, the value from site/setting will be used. (default: 10)
**config_revert_timer**: the rollback timer for commit confirmed (default: 10)
**dhcp_option_fqdn**: Enable to provide the FQDN with DHCP option 81 (default: false)
**enabled**: when enabled, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped
**trusted_hosts**: when `enabled`==`true`, all traffic that is not essential to our operation will be dropped (e.g. if dhcpd is enabled, we'll make sure it works)
**track_anonymous_devices**: whether to track anonymous BLE assets (requires ‘track_asset’ enabled) (default: false)
**enabled**: enable Virtual Network Assistant (using SUB-VNA license). This applied to AP / Switch / Gateway (default: false)
**vrf_instances**: the property key is the network name
**vrrp_groups**: the property key is the vrrp group
**duration**: window where a trigger will be detected and action to be taken (in seconds)
**enable_arp_spoof_check**: when proxy_arp is enabled, check for arp spoofing. (default: false)
**enable_channel_144**: whether to enable channel 144 (some older clients may not support it) (default: false)
**enable_vna**: enable Virtual Network Assistant (using SUB-VNA license) (default: false)
**enabled**: enable WIFI feature (using SUB-MAN license) (default: true)
**locate_connected**: whether to locate connected clients (default: false)
**locate_unconnected**: whether to locate unconnected clients (default: false)

**mesh_allow_dfs**: whether to allow Mesh to use DFS channels. For DFS channels, Remote Mesh AP would have to do CAC when scanning for new Base AP, which is slow and will distrupt the connection. If roaming is desired, keep it disabled. (default: false)
**mesh_enabled**: whether to enable Mesh feature for the site (default: false)
**mesh_psk**: optional passphrase of mesh networking, default is generated randomly
**mesh_ssid**: optional ssid of mesh networking, default is based on site_id
**email_notifiers**: list of email addresses to send email notifications when the alert threshold is reached
**enabled**: indicate whether zone occupancy alert is enabled for the site (default: false)

**threshold**: sending zone-occupancy-alert webhook message only if a zone stays non-compliant (i.e. actual occupancy > occupancy_limit) for a minimum duration specified in the threshold, in minutes (default: 5)
